intro: Caiophora venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
